Topic.Title: Performance wise, Tegra 4i could potentially take on Snapdragon 800, at half the size and one third the cost

Message.Msg: " Tegra 4 is fully integrated with LTE, whereas in S800, the LTE radio is ""on die"" - not integrated - sort of like AMD's APU." Excellent point! S800 MAY VERY LIKELY HAVE A HEAT ISSUE!! The LTE Chip on it's own draws a lot of power and if you put it in the same package as the APU - you would have to throttle down the 2.3GHz APU to prevent the fire alarms from going off!

SoC to SoC Tegra4i is about 85% the size of Snapdragon 800 and probably around 80% of the cost. Comparing a single core to another without its L2 cache and all the other SoC elements is pure self-deluding deception.

Message.Title: Another Nvidia Grid partner - Playcast Coming to the US This Year!
Message.Msg: Playcast is funded by JVP, arguably one of Israel’s most successful venture capital firms. Other Playcast investors include MK Capital, Xenia Venture Capital and C.Mer Industries. Tirosh and I spoke about what Playcast has learned about cloud gamers, including who they are, when they play and what are their favorite games. When was Playcast launched in France? Bouygues Telecom launched the service in July, to their new BBox Sensation users, and are currently expanding to their legacy customers. What has the adoption rate been among the subscribers? It’s still in the early days of the service, but initial results are extremely strong. Over one in ten users who get exposed to the service end up signing up for the Playcast service. What games are available? Playcast has partnerships with game publishers like Capcom, Codemasters, Atari, Disney, Sega, THQ and Warner Bros. Titles include “Street Fighter”, “Sonic Generations”, “Batman – Arkham City”, “Homefront”, “Test Drive Unlimited 2” and “Lego Batman.” It’s been reported that Playcast will be available in the United States this year, do you have any updates? We do anticipate a launch in the US, and are in talks with several major players. Source:forbesDOTcom/sites/eliseackerman/2013/02/25/lessons-learned-from-cloud-gaming-in-paris/2/

Message.Title: HOT LEAKS! Tegra 5 (Logan) to reature Kepler GPU, Tegra 6 gets Maxwell
Message.Msg: At this year’s CES conference, NVIDIA unveiled their latest mobile SOC Tegra 4 equipped with a Quad Core Cortex-A15 CPU and 72 GeForce class GPU cores. The chip has not been released to public yet and we have already got the first details on NVIDIA’s next-generation Tegra chip thanks to Sweclockers. NVIDIA Tegra 5 SOC To Get Kepler GPU Architecture According to the Sweclockers, the NVIDIA Tegra 5 SOC which would be codenamed “Logan” would feature NVIDIA’s latest Kepler GPU architecture. The addition of Kepler architecture on NVIDIA Tegra 5 would drop the need of separate pixel and vertex shaders and instead feature a unified architecture. This is the similar to what NVIDIA did with their GeForce 600 series lineup at launch by dropping the hot-clocks leaving only the GPU and memory clocks intact, this also resulted in 3 times the higher core count in Kepler generation of GPUs compared to Fermi. In return, the NVIDIA Tegra 5 chip featuring the Kepler architecture would become much more efficient by churning out better performance consuming much lower power. Compared to Tegra 4 “Wayne” which comes with 72 cores (48 pixel and 24 vertex shaders), the NVIDIA Tegra 5 SOC if comes with even one or two Kepler SMX units would result in 192 – 384 GPU cores. This would definitely be a drastic improvement over Tegra 4. The source also mentions that the move to Kepler architecture by NVIDIA is due to limited memory bandwidth available to the GPU on the current Tegra chips. Kepler did improve NVIDIA on the memory front boasting chips rated at 6 GB/s, so we would be looking at something similar from the mobile front in the future. SOURCE: wccftechDOTcom/nvidia-tegra-5-logan-soc-feature-kepler-gpu-architecture-tegra-6- maxwell/#ixzz2NKz1M73n ________ This is a reliable source. Previous leaks re. Tegra 4 have been borne out by facts.

Message.Title: iPads to fall behind Android tablets this year: IDC
Message.Msg: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Shipments of Apple Inc's iPads will fall behind the growing variety of tablets running Google Inc's Android platform for the first time this year as smaller-sized devices catch on with more consumers, research firm International Data Corp (IDC) said on Tuesday. iPad shipments are expected to account for 46 percent of the market in 2013, down from 51 percent last year, IDC said. Devices running Android are expected to grow their market share to 49 percent this year from 42 percent last year. IDC also raised its 2013 tablet shipment forecast to 190.9 million units, up from its previous forecast of 172.4 million units. Last year, global tablet shipments grew to 128.3 million units, up from 72 million in 2011, according to IDC.

Topic.Title: iPads to fall behind Android tablets this year: IDC

Message.Msg: With Apple being determined and focused on the very lucrative gaming sector, it's only a matter of time that Apple considers their eroding market share, and future capabilities in gaming as compared to Nvidia's ever increasing advancements as 2014 nears. Also, it would be a positive to have Nvidia associated with Apple gaming in order to garner instant respectability from the gaming community. It's widely known that Apple needs another revenue growing market that gaming would provide to compensate for their current stagnant market share across all lines. And it won't be the Apple TV, or wrist watch that will do it. I wouldn't be surprised if Apple & Nvidia are now developing an advanced offering that would stand-out from the crop of future consoles. If anything, Project Shield and GeForce Grid sure has given Apple, & perhaps MSFT, something to think about as they reflect on the future in gaming? I'm feeling more confident that Nvidia's dividend offering was influenced by the said possibility, and/or some high profile initiatives?

Message.Title: Agawi Announces True Cloud, Nvidia Grid Of Course
Message.Msg: Excerpts: "The previous iterations of cloud gaming have relied on piecemeal efforts and proprietary designs,” said Agawi co-founder Rajat Gupta. “And in today’s infinite-device landscape, developers that don’t create numerous versions of their games have been struggling to get maximum distribution and reach. Agawi True Cloud requires only one version of a game to ever be written in the cloud, and we can make it accessible on any post-PC era device—meaning that one game can reach an exponentially larger audience on tablets, phablets, TVs and next generation game devices like Project Shield.” With over four million gamers and 250 million minutes streamed thus far, Agawi is now opening up the cloud even more by integrating True Cloud with NVIDIA’s groundbreaking new GRID processors that allow up to 12 parallel GPUs. GRID excels in graphics quality and can serve dozens of game streams simultaneously from one server, providing an economic solution with the power to revolutionize the entire market. “By incorporating GRID servers, Agawi’s True Cloud is realizing the dream of gaming on any device, anywhere,” said Phil Eisler, general manager of NVIDIA GRID cloud gaming at NVIDIA. “The 12 GPUs found inside GRID K340 servers are designed to enable the smooth, seamless interactive experience of a high-performance gaming PC on mobile devices and unlock the cloud as the universal vehicle for fast and economical gaming.” Blue Box, PEER 1 and XO Communications have partnered with Agawi to streamline across cloud service providers, management service providers and colocation centers. The True Cloud architecture will eliminate heavy data storage and costs, making it increasingly affordable for game publishers to stream their games and for users to play titles instantly, from social to mid-core to AAA." Source: prwebDOTcom/releases/2013/2/prweb10439317.htm

Message.Title: NVIDIA will likely issue updated roadmaps for GPUs and the Tegra family of SoCs....
Message.Msg: NVIDIA has a LOT on the plate - not just clouding gaming/Grid, Project Shield, Project Denver, Project Boulder etc. There are multiple frontiers where competition isn't even close....just a matter of time. Meanwhile, the front runner should keep its (strategic ) advantages of being coy. Let's not assume the lack of any formal announcements is the absence of substance. NV has given us many positive surprises that were not in the roadmap, thus I wouldn't hold them responsible for not mentioning any specific developments. The management has better things to do - ie, growing the company, positioning itself against competition etc - than holding investors' hands.

Topic.Title: Damn good close

Message.Msg: Yes, and eggzzzzzaaaaaaaaaaaactly what I was looking for when I posted, earlier. Two things stand out. First, if you look at the intraday chart, you'll see one of THE most amazing "reverse head and shoulders" patterns that you'll EVER see in one day in a stock. Truly classic. Second, the late volume surge, AGAIN, coinciding with the rally back to new highs for the day. And, wow, those shorts put a LOT of BIG blocks in the way, and were finally able to knock the stock off the high by a few cents in the last few minutes. But, at 1PM, we had only 3.199mm shares and the stock was near the low of the day, at 12.57-58. Then, at 3PM, we only had 4.303mm, with the stock at 12.62-63, both LESS than yesterday. Even at 3:30, there was only 4.893mm, but the stock was about unched at 12.69-70. Then 5.138mm at 3:40, the stock 12.72-3, trying for a new high for the day.. That's when the volume REALLY spiked, and by 3:50 we had 5.919mm and the stock was at the high so far at 12.76-77. We hit 12.78 with a few minutes to go, but the Bears had to use 1.75mm MORE shares to keep the stock from moving higher and we finished with 7.7mm shares, MORE than yesterday. To ME, that's a "tell", and why I still think we will see 13 or higher, sometime before the week ends. Perhaps some MORE "chatter" will come from the Tech Press about GTC...;) I remember reading a book when I was a teenager, in French..."Les Jeux Sont Fait"....or "The Chips are Down"...nice pun, but really meaning Let the Games Begin...the "chips" are ON the TABLE...I couldn't help thinking about that book, the last few days, and today really looked like "Game ON, Boys and Girls", and all we need is a little MORE volume, ONE headline....ANYTHING, and we'll see the volume return to 10-15-20mm shares in a heartbeat, and the stock will soar. So, for my "friend" (I hope) Mslans, I've seen this "game" before, and the set up is truly compelling, at least to me. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Message.Title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Agreement
Message.Msg: I knew it. Nvidia used an ASR to repurchase shares in 4Q. From the 10K. "During November 2012, we entered into an accelerated share repurchase agreement, or an ASR, with an investment bank, under which we prepaid $100.0 million to purchase shares of our common stock. The aggregate number of shares ultimately purchased was determined based on the volume weighted-average share price, minus a discount, of our common stock over a specified period of time. By November 29, 2012, the investment bank delivered 7.3 million minimum shares. The contract was settled on January 24, 2013, and we received an additional 1.1 million shares at that time. The total number of shares repurchased under this ASR was 8.4 million shares at a weighted-average price of $11.90 per share." Smart move...Let Goldman or JP Morgan or Jefferies handle it. How much this quarter?

Topic.Title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Agreement

Message.Msg: Good find from the 10-K, j7777kxx.

Topic.Title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Agreement

Message.Msg: If I remember correctly what's great with ASR's is the investment bank is incentivized to get the best price based on the average of the daily high and low prices over the period contracted for. It just kills the incentive for people to short during the contracted period. Hope they put $200M in an ASR agreement for 1Q. They do have $1.14B left in the buyback program. I really suspect Nvidia is serious about cutting the share count significantly because they are confident about the business going forward. The share count dropped for the first time from one quarter to the next in 4 years. This is a big deal! JMHO

Topic.Title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Agreement

Message.Msg: Too me it's not so much that Nvidia's growing up. The stock buyback to me is matter of CONFIDENCE in the business going forward. I have followed Nvidia for years and traded the stock since 2009. The hit on the early failures on some GPUs in 2008 was a real shock to the company. Cash was cut in half and the stock dropped by a factor of 3. Thankfully I didn't own any stock then. Then along came the Intel squable and Nvidia's whole existence was threatened by Intel. PC makers were told if you use Nvidia chipsets no Intel CPUs for you. Nvidia came up with ION as a discrete gpiu and Apple stood by them with the original MacAir. Then for around 6 months vague rumors were floated in the Tech Press about Nvidia making an X86 CPU and what was all that hiring of former Transmeta employees doing at Nvidia. Nvidia filed a Lawsuit and Intel caved a week before the Jury was to be empaneled. Nvidia settled and said thank you very much for the $1.5B and I promise never to make an x86 CPU....but silently must have laughed all the way to the bank because voila within 2 months Tegra an ARM chip was born. So growing up is the wrong way to put....It's more like "We are Home Now" and Intel can't hurt us no more because High Cost CPUs are dinosaurs in consumer PCs except in Luxury laptops like Apple's, Gaming PC's, and Servers. Besides the Geekbench2 benchmarks prove that current generations of Intel I3 and I5 mobile processors are not all that great when an ARM based Tegra 4 can equal them for 1/10th the cost. Now Nvidia is in to so many new businesses along with Tegra mobile processors that even if the other 800 lb chipzilla QCOM delays adoption of Tegra 4 in phones Nvidia is in the best shape it has been in 5 years with a huge pile of cash....Over $6 a share. Hence the dividend and the on-going share buybacks.They have confidence going forward in the cash flow. Perhaps Tim Cook of Apple just doesn't see as rosy future for his company as Jensen does for his! As

Message.Title: Gaming Win 8 tablet, Razor Edge Pro, pre-order sales halted due to high demand (Win 8, Intel Core i5, NVIDIA graphics)
Message.Msg: On March 1st, Razer started taking pre-orders for its two Windows 8-based PC gaming tablets, the Razer Edge and the more expensive Razer Edge Pro. This week, the company's CEO has announced that it has stopped taking pre-orders for the Razer Edge Pro due to high demand. In a post on his Facebook page, CEO Min-Liang Tan stated: We've had to stop taking pre-orders for the Razer Edge Pro as the pre-orders have gone beyond our foreseeable manufacturing capacity (i.e. all stock is sold out for the months to come) ... We're doing everything we can to get more units out in the coming months. We appreciate the patience. The post did not state how many units of the Razer Edge Pro were ordered. Just a reminder: the 10.1 tablet has a Intel Core i7 processor, an an NVIDIA GT640M LE GPU and 8GB of DDR3 RAM. A 128GB version was being sold for $1,299 while a 256GB version was selling for for $1,499. Tan did say that there were very limited amounts of the cheaper Razer Edge tablet that are still available for sale on Razer's website. It is priced at $999 and comes with an Intel Core i5 processor, an NVIDIA GT640M LE GPU, 4GB of DDR3 RAM, and a 64GB SSD. Razer is also selling some accessories for both tablets including the Gamepad Controller for $249.99 that adds two game controllers, one on either side of the tablet. _______ Harbinger of good things to come for mobile gaming! Project Shield should command very favorable pricing IMHO.

Topic.Title: Gaming Win 8 tablet, Razor Edge Pro, pre-order sales halted due to high demand (Win 8, Intel Core i5, NVIDIA graphics)

Message.Msg: Source: neowinDOTnet/news/windows-8-based-razer-edge-pro-tablet-pre-orders-halted-due-to-high-demand?utm_source=twitterfeed&utm_medium=twitter

Message.Title: So what happens when Nvidia graphics marketshare drops to 10% from 16%
Message.Msg: by the end of this year. Will the stock go down or go up.

Topic.Title: So what happens when Nvidia graphics marketshare drops to 10% from 16%

Message.Msg: I am curious, what sector of the GPU market do you see this happening in? And from what?

Topic.Title: So what happens when Nvidia graphics marketshare drops to 10% from 16%

Message.Msg: Perhaps the 2GB and 3GB discrete graphics segment. Intel integrated CPUs and AMD's integrated APUs will take share from NVDA. Difficult to quantify product overlap market share gains. NVDA needs to use its cash to do some major buybacks. Looked like some buyers stepped in late in the day.
